{"title": "WORP", "title_search": "worp", "title_keyword": "worp", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/worp/", "summary": "? WORP is an amazing puzzle game, especially when you play Skippy Solitaire, Chinese Checkers or another strategy board game.  ?  WORP challenges you to a special brain training. Every level is both challenge and relaxation. Super-Computer WORP’s memory run full and has to be compressed down to a single bit. Intuitively learn the code for subtractive color synthesis an enjoy the electronic sounds of Konsorten™.  Features ? 9 different memories of increasing difficulty ? 3 difficulty levels – beginner, intermediate and advanced – for each of the 9 memories ? Atmospheric sound design by Konsorten™ ? Interrupt any time via the Home-button – resume where you left off ? Undo all moves even after resuming a game  Rules There are three Primary Bits (playing pieces), colored red, yellow and blue and marked with different symbols. These Primary Bits can become Combined Bits, colored orange, green, purple and black.  Select a bit and all possible moves are shown. With every move you have to jump over a neighboring bit. Primary Bits are removed.  Primary Bits can be passed by any primary Bit. A Primary Bit can be passed by other Primary Bits, thus erasing it. At the target Bits are added up and combined Bits can be created.  Combined Bits can be passed if they contain the colors of the passing bit. The passing bit color will be subtracted.  If all Bits except one are erased from the memory, WORP can calculate again and will unlock the next memory.", "genre": ["Adventure"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2009-05-28", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-122696-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-122696-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["Pixlers.at (Developer)", "Pixlers.at (Publisher)"], "platforms": ["iOS (iPhone/iPad)"], "rating": null}

When Avencast is descended upon by demonic hordes the very survival of his world is at stake.
